descript.abstract: Voting Precincts 2008. The dataset contains polygons representing District of Columbia voting precinct boundaries. Precincts were changed based on the ward redistricting following the 2000 census, and changes for 2002. Precincts were established by the Board of Elections and Ethics and created as part of the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and participating D.C. government agencies. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters. METADATA CONTENT IS IN PROCESS OF VALIDATION AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE.
descript.purpose: This data is used for the planning and management of Washington, D.C. by local government agencies.

srcinfo.srccontr: boundaries of 1990 based voting precincts which were altered to fit the new 2000 Ward boundaries

procstep.procdesc: Precincts were identified from public records (D.C. Board of Elections and Ethics) and initially created selecting street arcs from the WGIS planimetric street centerlines and, where necessary, heads-up digitized from the 1995 orthophotographs. A base ArcInfo coverage of correct line work (snapbase.e00) for all DC data was developed after the final delivery of the planimetric street centerlines. The precinct datasets were selected from the snapbase coverage, creating coincident geography with the other DC GIS datasets. Updates were made, in conjuction with BOEE, in 2002 following the snapbase. When imported into the DC GIS geodatabase the coverages shift 0.01mm since the geodatabase supports only 11 digits of precision, not double precision (16 digits). Planimetrics were created at a scale of 1:1,000. This means that a well defined feature falls within two feet of true position. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters.

cntorgp.cntorg: D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer

procstep.procdesc: Updated voting precincts to reflect the 2008 elections. Two voting precincts near chinatown had new boundaries.

Edits were made to voter precinct boundaries 6, 7, 11, and 80 to match the shared portion of the 2002 Ward boundary layer (Ward02Ply). Post-edit testing verified that all residences remained in the same precincts prior to boundary updates.
